item.title: How I Dockerize My Flask App With Pypy and Supervisord
item.description: There are buch of ways how to deploy your Flask application, it can be directly with Flask’s built in http server or using UWSGI as gateway interface, with or without Nginx as your HTTP frontend. People also either run Flask application directly on their machine or as a container with docker. In this post, I will share the way I deploy my Flask application. Lately, I prefer to use PyPy rather than using pure Python to achieve more speed processing time (thanks to its JIT Compiler) and using Gevent to handle more concurrency.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, my name is Yudanta. I am a software developer based in Indonesia who have big interest in Natural Language Processing and Deep Learning. I speak with Python almost in everyday basis, sometimes Java, Elixir and used to with PHP. …
